name: lbsex

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wne(c1, emptycls))
-| wac
-| wi(wa(wac, wcel(c0, clvec)), wne(c1, emptycls))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LVec → c1 ≠ ∅)
⊣ wac
⊣ ((CHOICE ∧ c0 ∈ LVec)→ c1 ≠ ∅)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wne(c1, emptycls))
-| wac
-| wi(wa(wac, wcel(c0, clvec)), wne(c1, emptycls))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ LVec → c1 ≠ ∅)
⊣ wac
⊣ ((CHOICE ∧ c0 ∈ LVec)→ c1 ≠ ∅)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wne(c1, emptycls))
-| wi(wa(wac, wcel(c0, clvec)), wne(c1, emptycls))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wac, wcel(c0, clvec)), wne(c1, emptycls))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clbs, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wne(c1, emptycls))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clbs, c0))

comment: Every vector space has a basis. This theorem is an AC equivalent. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2014.)
